e4: Transitioning to the new policy enhances trust and aligns with ethical practices by eliminating bias in financial reporting. Despite initial investor confusion, clear communication about the change can mitigate misunderstandings. Overall, truthful reporting is crucial for long-term credibility and compliance with regulatory expectations, reducing potential legal risks.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should provide accurate, unbiased, and transparent financial information, ensuring all investors have equal access to truthful data. It should comply with regulatory standards, promote fairness, and prioritize the firm’s long-term reputation and integrity. Ethical policies also require clear communication to minimize misunderstandings and protect all investor interests.
e6: What measures will be taken to ensure effective communication of the policy change to all investors? How does the management plan to mitigate potential impacts on stock price during the transition? What internal controls will be implemented to maintain unbiased reporting and compliance with regulatory standards going forward?
